title: ASA Physical Status Classification System
description: Classifies health of patients prior to surgery based on systemic disease and functional limitations. Used by anesthesiologists to assess preoperative risk and guide perioperative care.

parameters.name: physical_status
parameters.description: Patient's physical status based on systemic disease and functional limitations

parameters.name: emergency_surgery
parameters.description: Whether this is an emergency surgery (delay would significantly increase threat to life or body part)

result.name: asa_classification
result.description: Final ASA Physical Status Classification with emergency modifier if applicable

classifications.interpretation: A normal healthy patient with no systemic disease. Examples: healthy non-smoking patient with no or minimal alcohol use, normal BMI.

A patient with mild systemic disease without substantive functional limitations. Examples: current smoker, social alcohol drinker, pregnancy, obesity (BMI 30-40), well-controlled diabetes/hypertension, mild lung disease.

A patient with severe systemic disease with substantive functional limitations. Examples: poorly controlled diabetes or hypertension, COPD, morbid obesity (BMI â‰¥40), active hepatitis, alcohol dependence, pacemaker, ESRD on dialysis, history of MI/CVA/TIA >3 months.

classifications.description: Patient with severe systemic disease that is constant threat to life
classifications.interpretation: A patient with severe systemic disease that is a constant threat to life. Examples: recent (<3 months) MI/CVA/TIA, ongoing cardiac ischemia, severe valve dysfunction, shock, sepsis, DIC, ESRD not on scheduled dialysis.

classifications.description: Moribund patient not expected to survive without operation
classifications.interpretation: A moribund patient who is not expected to survive without the operation. Examples: ruptured abdominal/thoracic aneurysm, massive trauma, intracranial bleed with mass effect, ischemic bowel with significant cardiac pathology.
A declared brain-dead patient whose organs are being removed for donor purposes.

formula: Clinical assessment-based classification system ranging from ASA I (normal healthy patient) to ASA VI (brain-dead organ donor). Emergency modifier 'E' added when delay in treatment would significantly increase threat to life or body part.
notes: The ASA Physical Status Classification System has been in use for over 60 years
The classification system alone does not predict perioperative risks but is used with other factors
Final assignment should be made on the day of anesthesia care by the anesthesiologist
The system is subjective and may have interrater variability
Age is not specifically included in the classification system
The 'E' modifier denotes emergency surgery but does not change the underlying physical status
This classification should be used alongside other risk assessment tools for comprehensive perioperative evaluation
